title: Advantages of Widgets
synopsis: Some notes, thoughts and research on the advantages of using widgets in Livecode:

title: Currently Working On
synopsis: Here is a list of [[Recent Changes]] I consider important. View our experiments on the [[Scratch]] page. To clear stuff saved in your browser try [[Local Changes]].

title: Emscripten
synopsis: [[Emscripten]] is a source-to-source compiler ([[Transpiler]]), that transforms [[LLVM]] bytecode, typically created by compiling from C or C++, to JavaScript. It produces a subset of [[JavaScript]] known as [[asm.js]] - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emscripten wikipedia]

title: Livecode Buider Libraries
synopsis: Libraries are collections of commands and functions that integrate into the engine in exactly the same way as engine commands and functions do (the only caveat being initially is that you will be restricted to generic function / command call syntax to access them. Full and proper syntax bindings will have to wait until [[Open Language]] is born).

title: LiveCode Builder
synopsis: Livecode Builder is a new dialect of LiveCode in which you are able to write things called extensions. An extension will (in the first instance) either be a library or a widget - [http://livecode.com/the-present-and-future-livecode/ livecode.com]

title: Livecode Extensions
synopsis: Livecode extensions are written in [[Livecode Builder]] and come in two flavours; [[widgets]] and [[Libraries]].

title: LiveCodeish
synopsis: [[Livecode Builder]] extensions will be based upon a "new dialect" of LiveCode (let's call it [[LiveCodeish]].

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: Welcome to this [[Federated Wiki]] site about [[Livecode Extensions]]. Here we write about code and programming in the [[Livecode Builder]] languages.

title: Widgets
synopsis: [[Widgets]] are collections of commands, functions and event handlers that together create a new control type, or widget.
